author: Elizabeth Bernstein
title: How to Spot Teenage Depression
text:
Is your child’s moodiness a sign of typical teenage angst—or the beginning of a depression that needs professional attention?
Statistics show that teen depression is on the rise. In 2016, around 13% of U.S. teenagers ages 12-17 had at least one major depressive episode in the past year, compared to almost 8% in 2006, according to the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration, which collects this information.
